title: Teriyakii salmon with stir fried vegetables
text: This Teriyaki salmon with stir fried vegetables is a delicious and healthy meal that's easy to prepare. The salmon is marinated in a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce, then grilled to perfection and served with a medley of stir-fried vegetables.

preparation.title: Preparation:
preparation.explanation:
Begin by preparing the teriyaki sauce. 

In a small saucepan, combine soy sauce, mirin, sake (or water), brown sugar, honey, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally until the sugar dissolves. Reduce heat and let it simmer for 5 minutes. Add a cornstarch slurry to thicken, stirring constantly. Set aside.

Place salmon fillets in a dish and pour half of the teriyaki sauce over them to marinate for at least 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

Heat vegetable oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Sear salmon fillets, skin-side up, for 2-3 minutes until browned. Flip and transfer skillet to the oven. Bake for 8-10 minutes until cooked through.

For the stir-fried vegetables, heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. Stir-fry onion until softened. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, julienned carrots, broccoli florets, snap peas, and bell peppers. Stir-fry for 4-5 minutes until tender-crisp. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce (optional), and sesame oil. Season with salt and pepper.

To serve, brush baked salmon with reserved teriyaki sauce. Plate stir-fried vegetables and place salmon fillets on top. Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions. Serve immediately.

This recipe serves 4 people. Adjust quantities as needed for larger or smaller servings.

title: Vegetarian black bean chili
text: This vegetarian black bean chili is hearty, filling, and packed with flavor. It's a great way to enjoy a healthy, plant-based meal that's full of protein and fiber.
ingredients: 2 cans black beans, drained and rinsed

preparation.title: Preparation:
preparation.explanation: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, bell pepper, and carrot, and sauté until softened. Stir in the chili powder, cumin, and paprika, and cook for another minute. Add the black beans, vegetable broth, and diced tomatoes, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 30 minutes, until the chili has thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Quinoa and avocado salad
text: This quinoa and avocado salad is a light and refreshing dish that's perfect for a healthy lunch or side dish. It's packed with protein and healthy fats to keep you satisfied.

preparation.title: Preparation:
preparation.explanation: Rinse the quinoa under cold water. In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Add the quinoa, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the water is absorbed. Let the quinoa cool. In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, avocado, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and cilantro. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and lime juice, and pour over the salad. Toss to combine and season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Pesto pasta cherries pine nuts
text: This pesto pasta with cherries and pine nuts is a unique and delicious combination of flavors. The sweet cherries and crunchy pine nuts add a special touch to the classic pesto pasta.

preparation.title: Preparation:
preparation.explanation: Cook the pasta according to the package instructions. In a food processor, combine the basil leaves, Parmesan cheese, pine nuts, and garlic. Pulse until finely chopped. With the processor running, slowly add the olive oil until the pesto is smooth. In a large bowl, toss the cooked pasta with the pesto and cherries. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

title: Peppers with quinoa black beans
text: These stuffed peppers with quinoa and black beans are a healthy and flavorful meal that's perfect for a vegetarian dinner. They're packed with protein and fiber to keep you full and satisfied.
ingredients: 4 bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed

preparation.title: Preparation:
preparation.explanation: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, cumin, and chili powder. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture and place them in a baking dish. Top each pepper with shredded cheese. Cover the dish with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

title: Mediterranean quinoa bowl
text: This Mediterranean quinoa bowl is a colorful and healthy dish that's packed with fresh vegetables and flavors. It's perfect for a light lunch or dinner.

preparation.title: Preparation:
preparation.explanation: Rinse the quinoa under cold water. In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Add the quinoa, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the water is absorbed. Let the quinoa cool. In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, Kalamata olives, red onion, parsley, and feta cheese. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and lemon juice, and pour over the salad. Toss to combine and season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Fish tacos with mango salsa
text: These fish tacos with mango salsa are a fresh and flavorful meal that's perfect for a summer dinner. The mango salsa adds a sweet and tangy flavor that pairs perfectly with the crispy fish.

preparation.title: Preparation:
preparation.explanation: In a medium bowl, combine the mango, red onion, jalapeno, cilantro, and lime juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside. Season the fish fillets with salt and pepper. Dredge each fillet in flour, then dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook the fish fillets until golden and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per side. Warm the tortillas in a dry skillet. Assemble the tacos by placing a piece of fish on each tortilla and topping with mango salsa.

title: Coconut curry chicken
text: This falafel wrap is a delicious and satisfying meal that's perfect for lunch or dinner. The falafel is crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, and it's wrapped in a warm pita with fresh vegetables and a tangy tahini sauce.

preparation.title: Preparation:
preparation.explanation: In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, parsley, cilantro, onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, baking powder, salt, and pepper. Process until the mixture is well combined but still slightly chunky. Shape the mixture into small patties. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook the patties until golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Warm the pita breads in a dry skillet. Assemble the wraps by placing the falafel patties in the pitas and topping with shredded lettuce, tomato, red onion, and tahini sauce.
